content: I've imported a bunch of content into a Backdrop site; I'd now like to turn on node revisions for all of the nodes on the site, en masse. How would I do that?
I can't figure out where this is set in the database; don't see it in the node table
Huh -- is it actually in the node_revision table? Does EVERY node have an entry in that table, even if it doesn't have any revisions besides the original one?
@Jack You enable it per content type. Look for the "Revision settings" tab.

@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) AFAICT that doesn't affect existing nodes that don't already have content revisions enabled....huh, but maybe my problem was that for the Page content type new revisions weren't enabled by default before the import, ugh.
Nevertheless, I'd assume there must be a programmatic way to change this for all nodes on a site, same way I can use an UPDATE MySQL query to close comments on all nodes on the site.
Huh -- @oadaeh (Jason Flatt) I think I might be seeing what you're saying...

Yes! Now that I've enabled new revisions by default for the Page content type, I haven't found a single imported page that doesn't have "Create new revision" enabled by default when I edit the node. Revisions enabled isn't a value set on a per-node basis, it's set on a per-content-type basis as you said AND it applies to all nodes, not just nodes you create after fixing that setting.
Problem was I was convinced that I had new revisions enabled by default for the Page content type already, but when I just checked I didn't. Whoops!
Thanks for the help sorting that out @oadaeh (Jason Flatt) !
